title: Showery conditions expected to reduce from today
byline: Showery condition over the island is expected to reduce from today (15), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: PM Harini urges ‘“New Era of Revival” amid challenges in Thai Pongal message
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya, in her message for Thai Pongal, has extended her heartfelt greetings to the Tamil people in Sri Lanka and abroad who celebrate the Thai Pongal festival, describing it as a proud tradition that expresses gratitude for the dignity of labour and the protection bestowed by nature.

title: President calls for national unity and collective reconstruction on Thai Pongal Day
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, in his Thai Pongal message, highlighted the festival’s profound spiritual, cultural, and environmental significance, describing it as a celebration of gratitude, renewal, and collective hope for the future.

title: UNDP confirms widespread economic fallout from Cyclone Ditwah, calls for inclusive access to recovery financing
byline: Nearly all communities affected by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka suffered damage to homes, roads and other critical infrastructure, according to a new United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) assessment released on Wednesday, underscoring the scale of recovery needs and the urgency of accessible financing for the most vulnerable.

title: Opposition Leader emphasizes cultural awareness and respect for nature in Thai Pongal message
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa extended his heartfelt wishes to Tamil communities across Sri Lanka and worldwide “wishing everyone a meaningful celebration of this cultural festival, with a true understanding of the spirit of Thai Pongal.”

title: Another crane collapses in Thailand killing 2 people, police say
byline: A crane collapsed in Thailand on Thursday, crushing two vehicles and killing two people, police said, a day after a crane accident in the northeast caused the deaths of 32 train passengers.

title: Iran warns of retaliation if Trump strikes, US withdraws some personnel from bases
byline: The United States is withdrawing some personnel from bases in the Middle East, a U.S. official said on Wednesday, after a senior Iranian official said Tehran had warned neighbours it would hit American bases if Washington strikes.

title: Dilith Jayaweera extends Thai Pongal greetings, highlights importance of social values
byline: The leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ and Member of Parliament entrepreneur Dilith Jayaweera in his Thai Pongal Day message has extended his heartfelt greetings to all Tamil devotees celebrating Thai Pongal today.

title: Safety guidelines issued for Sri Lankans in Israel amid Middle East tensions
byline: In view of the current and escalating unrest in the Middle East region, a set of guidelines for Sri Lankans working and residing in Israel has been issued by the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Israel.

title: UK-based couple donates £2,000 to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: A UK-based couple residing near the Sri Lankan High Commission to the United Kingdom have donated £2,000 to the Government’s ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ fund.

title: Sri Lanka ranked 93rd in Henley Passport Index 2026 with access to 39 destinations
byline: Sri Lanka has climbed up to the 93rd rank in the Henley Passport Index 2026, with access to 39 destinations, according to the latest global passport rankings released by Henley & Partners.

title: The full list of 75 countries where Trump is suspending visa processing
byline: The Trump administration has indefinitely suspended immigrant visa processing for people from 75 countries, marking one of its most expansive efforts yet to restrict legal pathways to the United States.

title: 55-year-old attacked to death in Nawalapitiya over personal dispute
byline: A personal dispute between two brothers-in-law has reportedly ended in a fatal assault in the Gondennawa area of Nawalapitiya Police Division, police said.

title: Indian Defence Minister calls for honouring IPKF soldiers’ sacrifices in Sri Lanka
byline: The sacrifices made by Indian soldiers during Operation Pawan in Sri Lanka nearly four decades ago should be honoured, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Wednesday, appearing to criticise the governments in the 1990s for not publicly recognising their contributions.

title: Suspect arrested over gold necklace thefts and drug possession
byline: A suspect who fled after stealing gold necklaces using stolen motorcycles has been arrested by the police.

title: Ailing astronaut returns to Earth early in NASA’s first medical evacuation
byline: An ailing astronaut returned to Earth with three others on Thursday, ending their space station mission more than a month early in NASA’s first medical evacuation.

title: Two killed in fatal tipper truck accident in Jaffna
byline: Two individuals have reportedly died in a road accident that had occurred in the Navathkuli area of Thenmarachchi on the Jaffna-Mannar main road.

title: Industry bodies flag gaps in Draft National Electricity Policy
byline: The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, together with several leading industry chambers associations, have submitted joint observations on the Draft National Electricity Policy, stating that a number of critical issues have not been adequately addressed.

title: Showers expected in several districts tomorrow
byline: Showers or thundershowers may occur at a few places in Kaluthara, Galle, Matara and Rathnapura districts after 4.00 p.m. tomorrow (16) while mainly fair weather will prevail elsewhere, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Singapore’s opposition leader stripped of title after conviction for lying
byline: Singapore’s Leader of the Opposition in parliament, Pritam Singh, has been stripped of his title by the prime minister following a vote by lawmakers.

title: After exceeding 2025 revenue target, IRD aims for Rs. 2,402 billion in 2026
byline: The Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has been set a revenue target of Rs. 2,402 billion for the fiscal year 2026, the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue Nandana Kumara said.

title: Three traders fined Rs. 1 mln each for selling rice at inflated prices
byline: The Welisara Magistrate’s Court has fined three traders Rs. 1 million each for selling rice at inflated prices above the stipulated control prices.

title: Turkish Airlines flight makes emergency landing in Barcelona after ‘threat’ alert
byline: A Turkish Airlines flight made an emergency landing Thursday at Barcelona’s El Prat Airport after a passenger created an in-flight wireless network whose name contained a bomb threat, an airlines spokesperson said.

title: Australia social media ban hits 4.7 million teen accounts in first month
byline: Social media companies have collectively deactivated nearly five million accounts belonging to Australian teenagers just a month after a world-first ban on under‑16s took effect, the country’s internet regulator said, a sign the measure has had a swift and sweeping impact.

title: President launches construction of 50MW HayWind wind power project in Mannar
byline: In line with the Government’s policy to achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2050, construction of the 50-megawatt wind power project developed by Hayleys Fentons Limited in Mannar was officially launched this morning (15) under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Veteran singer Raju Bandara passes away
byline: Veteran singer and musician Raju Bandara has passed away at the age of 65, according to family sources.

title: CAA raids fuel station in Beruwala hoarding petrol
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has raided a fuel station in Beruwala for allegedly concealing fuel stocks and selling fuel at higher prices after claiming that Octane 92 petrol was unavailable.

title: IMF fact-finding mission to visit Sri Lanka from January 22–28
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has decided to send a fact-finding mission to Sri Lanka from January 22 to January 28 to assess the damage caused by the recent cyclone Ditwah.

title: European military personnel arrive in Greenland as Trump says US needs island
byline: A 15-strong French military contingent has arrived in Greenland’s capital Nuuk, as several European states send soldiers there as part of a so-called reconnaissance mission.

title: Let’s build a prosperous nation free of racism and rich in unity - President at Jaffna Thai Pongal Festival
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that the Government’s objective is to build a prosperous country free of racism and filled with national unity, where all citizens can live with dignity regardless of the language they speak or the religion they practise.
